actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources

official_title: To ensure the orderly development of coal, coalbed methane, natural gas, and oil in common areas of the Powder River Basin, Wyoming and Montana, and for other purposes.
short_title: Powder River Basin Resource Development Act of 2001
subjects: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

summary.text: Powder River Basin Resource Development Act of 2001 - Authorizes and encourages Federal coal lessees and oil and gas developers to enter into a written agreement that details operations, and assigns or assesses costs or compensation regarding the contemporaneous concurrent, or sequential development of coal, natural gas, and oil in the Powder River Basin.Prescribes guidelines for petitions to a U.S. district court and court proceedings for relief and assignment of a development priority in the event that a Federal coal lessee and an oil and gas developer do not reach such an agreement.Declares that this Act does not serve as precedent for leasing for mineral development outside of any common area within the Powder River Basin.

titles.title: Powder River Basin Resource Development Act of 2001
To ensure the orderly development of coal, coalbed methane, natural gas, and oil in common areas of the Powder River Basin, Wyoming and Montana, and for other purposes.
